page.title: 11TOURISM
page.content: Stratford on Avon is a very popular town for tourists mainly because of the Shakespeare connections. Shakespeare was born in Stratford and is buried at Holy Trinity church which stands on the banks of the River Avon. There is much for the tourist to see. The Royal Shakespeare Theatre and museum, the Shakespeare centre ,Nash's house and the World of Shakespeare. Stratford is also a picturesque Tudor town in its own right and the beautiful River Avon winds its way through the town.A survey we conducted showed that over a half of the tourists we interviewed (from a sample of 32 )were day trippers.Over three quarters of tourists were in the 20_40 yrs age bracket and they had come from a variety of destinations;a half were from U.S.A.and one fifth from continental countries.
